articles.title: Neanderthals hunted massive elephants that once roamed northern Europe - CNN
articles.description: Some 125,000 years ago, enormous elephant-like creatures roamed in what's now northern Europe. Despite their size, the animals were routinely hunted for meat by Neanderthals, according to a study of remains of the extinct species found in Germany.
